ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course was one of my favorites at Yale!! I spent so much time critically examining my ideas about democracy in theory and practice + strengthened my research skills considerably
Learned how to read academic papers in a serious and rigorous way. Also learned how to write on myself and collect my own data.
I gained insight into processes of democratization and the comparative politics subfield more generally.
Developed research skills, quantitative analysis skills, and skills in how to write a political science paper.
This course was very useful in developing critical thinking and learning about the method of political science.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: Very well organized, excellent discussions, appreciated the intermediate assignments to keep me on task with the term paper 
Weakness: Sometimes it felt like we didnt have enough time to do justice to all the readings
The readings were a lot but very interesting and helpful. The final project was also a lot but not overwhelming. Overall, I am happy with the way the course was designed.

This course was overall fantastic. I felt a little out of my depth at times as the course sometimes assumes a bit of knowledge and familiarity with the subject area, but I feel like I learned a lot in the process.

Professor Brancati is amazing and so supportive. If you have a chance to take class with her, please do! Especially if you are a political science major, her class will help you develop the skills needed for your senior thesis.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if youre a plsc major looking for a challenging seminar!
Yes! Professor Brancati was amazing and super good at giving me feedback. I felt genuinely happy to have taken this course.
I would recommend this course to those already interested in/with a background in comparative politics or to those interested in challenging themselves.
yes in order to grow skills that teach engagement with research papers (how to read and write)

YES! If you are interested in political science theories of democratization, take this class! Also if you are looking to develop your qualitative and quantitative skills in poli sci research, take this class!
Yes, I learned a lot from this course.
